### Chapter Fifteen: Concerning the Breath of the All-Merciful (النفس الرحماني) in the Manifest Divine Name (الاسم الإلهي الظاهر)

And its direction toward the creation of the Universal Body (الجسم الكل), and concerning the letters, toward the letter Ghayn (غ), and concerning the Lunar Mansions, toward the head of Gemini, which is Al-Haq'ah (الهقعة), also called Al-Maysān.

#### That when Allah placed the operative power in the Soul, He manifested through it the form of the Universal Body in the substance of the Haba' (الهباء).

Know that when Allah, Exalted is He, placed the operative power (القوة العملية) in the Soul (النفس), Allah manifested through it the form of the Universal Body (الجسم الكل) in the substance of the Haba' (جوهر الهباء), thereby occupying the Void (الخلأ). And the Void is an imagined extension in non-body. Since we saw that this Universal Body accepted no shape except circularity, we knew that the Void is circular, as this body occupied the Void. Thus, what is outside the body is not described by voidness nor fullness.

Then Allah opened up the forms of the world within this body. Since He created this body as circular, having occupied the entire Void, its movement was within its own void. It is not a movement of transference away from it, but rather its movement within itself as a whole, like the movement of a millstone. You look at its movement as a whole and find that it has not moved from its place, yet you look at the movement of every part of it and find it moving from its space to another space through the movement of the whole. Thus, every circular movement is moving and stationary, because it has neither vacated its space by transference as a whole, nor has it rested so as to be described by stillness. This only occurs in the circular. As for the non-circular, it is not called a sphere (فلك)—that is, circular—due to its shape.

This is the first of the natural forms. Nature manifested its ruling within it, so it accepted heat, moisture, coldness, and dryness, specifically through the ruling of transgression in the two opposites. So it moved due to the dominance of heat over it, for nothing whatsoever manifests from equilibrium (الاعتدال). For this reason, The Real described Himself with Satisfaction, Wrath, Mercy, Vengeance, Forbearance, and Overpowering. Existence and formation (تكوين) are not valid with equilibrium. Do you not see that were it not for the Divine Direction (التوجه الإلهي) toward the creation of something, it would not exist? And were it not for His saying to it, "Be!" (كن), it would not come into being.

Since the quantity of heat was greater than others in the body, it imparted movement to it. There is no void except that which this body occupied, and it must move, so it moved in its place, which is the movement of the center, because there is no void outside it for it to move toward. Movement is sought by heat, and it is a movement of transference within the whole. And Allah manifested the forms of the entire world in this body, based on different predispositions (استعدادات) in every form, even though they are gathered by one body and one ruler. So the forms accepted the spirits (الأرواح) from the Breath of the All-Merciful (النفس الرحماني), just as the letters accepted the meanings (المعاني) upon their emergence, to signify the meaning for which they emerged. And the ruling of Time (الزمان) appeared through movement, so the forms appeared in sequence, accepting temporal priority and posteriority. And the ruling of the Divine Names (الأسماء الإلهية) appeared through the existence of these forms and what they bear.

We have mentioned in the 'Knot of the Hastener' how the order of the world's existence came to be. And for Allah, as we mentioned, there is a special face (وجه خاص) in it, and in everything that exists within it, and it came into existence through that special face. The cause (السبب) never knows that special face belonging to its effect, nor does the Intellect or the Soul, except Allah specifically, and that is the subtlety of Generosity (رقيقة الجود). So it moved by Divine Existence (الوجود الإلهي), not by the action of the Soul. This is the movement of the Breath of the All-Merciful for the creation of the Words (الكلمات).

So He leveled the Throne (العرش) and unified the All-Merciful Word (الكلمة الرحمانية) within it. Then He created the form of the Footstool (الكرسي), and the Word divided within it, and the two Feet (القدمان) were lowered toward it. Due to this lowering, the Word divided, so to Him belongs Creation and Command (الخلق والأمر), and its division was into ruling (حكم) and information (خبر).

Then He rotated the Atlas Sphere (الفلك الأطلس) with a special direction, for a wisdom He concealed from whomever He willed and revealed to others. And He divided it into twelve measures, so the measures became comprehensive, and He made them constellations (بروج) for angelic spirits (أرواح ملكية) of different natures. Each constellation was named after that angel who made that measure his constellation, dwelling in it with his men, like the towers surrounding the wall of a city, or like the ranks of governors in a kingdom. These are the constellations known to the people of learning. And every constellation has three faces (وجوه), for the First Intellect (العقل الأول) has three faces, even though it is one. There is no reality that exists in the first except that the second must contain it and add to it a ruling that the first does not possess, provided that the prior entity is other than Allah.

#### That Allah is with everything

As for Allah, He is with everything, so nothing precedes Him and nothing follows Him. This ruling does not belong to anyone other than Allah. For this reason, He has a special face toward every existent thing, because He is the cause (سبب) of every existent thing. And every existent thing is one; it cannot be two. And He is One, so nothing emanated from Him except one. For He is in the oneness (أحدية) of every single thing. Even if multiplicity (الكثرة) is found, it is by considering the oneness of Time, which is the container (الظرف). The existence of The Real in this multiplicity is in the oneness of every single thing, so nothing manifested from Him except one. This is the meaning of 'nothing emanates from the One except one.' Even if the entire world emanated from Him, nothing emanated from Him except one. Thus, He is with every single thing by virtue of its oneness. This is only grasped by the People of Allah (أهل الله). The philosophers (الحكماء) state it in a different way, and this is where they erred.

And Allah established for every governor dwelling in this constellation known rulings derived from specific cycles, which this chapter is not the place to enumerate or specify. Then Allah opened up the form of the Starry Sphere (الفلك المكوكب), and after it, the Earth, Water, Air, and Fire, resulting from the movement of the Sphere of Constellations and the rays of the stars of the Starry Sphere. Then smoke rose from the fire of the Elements (الأركان), since it was a composite fire, and in that smoke, He manifested the forms of the Heavens (السموات) as spheres following one another. And He placed a star in every sphere, as the mention of all that will come, if Allah wills. And through this Divine Name, He created in the Human Soul (النفس الإنساني) the letter Ghayn (غ) and the mansion of Al-Haq'ah (الهقعة).

***

### Chapter Sixteen: Concerning the Divine Name The Wise (الحكيم)

And its direction toward the creation of Shape (الشكل), and the letter Khā' (خ), and the mansion of Al-Nuhyah (النحية) among the Mansions, which is called Al-Han'ah (الهنعة).

Shape (الشكل) is the restriction (القيد). By it is named the shackle (شكال) with which an animal is restricted by its leg. And the shaped thing (المتشكل) is that which is restricted by the shape through which it appeared. Allah says: <<كُلٌّ يَعْمَلُ عَلى‏ شاكِلَتِهِ>> (Everyone acts according to his own disposition/pattern), meaning, he only acts according to what resembles him. And its meaning returns to this: that which manifests from him indicates what he is in himself. And the entire world is the work of Allah, so His work is according to His disposition (شاكلته). Thus, there is nothing in the world that is not in Allah.

And the world is confined within ten [categories] due to the perfection of its form, since it exists upon the form of its Originator (الموجد). So the substance (جوهر) of the world is for the Essence (ذات) of the Originator; the accident (عرض) of the world is for His Attributes (صفات); its time (زمان) is for His Pre-eternity (أزل); its place (مكان) is for His Establishment (استواء); its quantity (كم) is for His Names (أسماء); its quality (كيف) is for His Satisfaction and Wrath; its position (وضع) is for His Speech (كلام); its relation (إضافة) is for His Lordship (ربوبية); its action (أن يفعل) is for His creation (إيجاد); and its passion (أن ينفعل) is for His answering whoever asks Him. So the work of the world is according to His disposition: <<فَرَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ هُوَ أَهْدى‏ سَبِيلًا>> (But your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way) and He is <<عَلى‏ صِراطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ>> (upon a straight path). Thus, the world is upon a straight path; the curvature of the bow is its straightness, so do not be veiled.

Do you not see that the Void ruled over the body with circularity, so it manifested it as a circular sphere? That is its disposition (شاكلته), so the disposition of the locus ruled over it. Gabriel appeared in the form of Dihyah, and he was unknown, so he was called a human, yet he was an angel. Those who knew him knew him as an angel, but the form was human. The knowledge of his angelhood did not affect the form of his humanity, nor did ignorance of it affect it.

Thus, shapes are perpetually restrictive. This is what the Name The Wise (الحكيم) bestowed, arranging matters in their levels and assigning measures (مقادير) to things. And from the Human Soul (النفس الإنساني), the letter Khā' (خ) appeared in the points of articulation, and from the Lunar Mansions, Al-Nuhyah (النحية).

There is nothing that appeared in the details of the world except that there is a corresponding form in the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية) that resembles what appeared—meaning, it is restricted by it—and were it not for that form, it would not have appeared. Do you not see how the Atlas Sphere (الفلك الأطلس) appeared from the perplexity (الحيرة) concerning The Real? Because the measures within it are not specified due to the similarity of its parts, just as the Names and Attributes of The Real are not multiplied. Perplexity only appeared in the Atlas Sphere, where it is said that it contains constellations, yet they are not specified, so it was placed in the shape of perplexity. And the Starry Sphere (الفلك المكوكب), with its Mansions, was placed in the shape of indications (دلالات) concerning that in which perplexity occurred. Thus, the Mansions are used to infer the constellations in the Atlas Sphere, so it is in the shape of indication. And the variety of rulings, due to the descent of the wandering stars (السيارة) into the Mansions and Constellations, was made analogous to the Divine Forms in which The Real manifests. So, by the ruling that the Atlas Sphere has in them, one becomes ignorant, and it is said that Allah has no form, based on rational indication. And by the indications that the Mansions have in them, one gains knowledge, and it is said, 'This is The Real.' So look at what the ruling of ambiguity (الإشكال) has done. From this comes ambiguity in matters, for it gives rise to perplexity concerning the known thing. And the shape of a thing is its likeness. Shape is familiar with its shape, and the opposite is ignorant of its opposite. And the world (الدنيا) is for mixing (الامتزاج), and the Hereafter (الآخرة) is for purification (التخليص), so they are in the shape of the two grips (القبضتين).

***

### Chapter Seventeen: Concerning the Name The All-Encompassing (المحيط)

And its direction toward the creation of the Throne (العرش), the Glorified, Magnified, and Honored Throne, and the letter Qāf (ق), and the mansion of Al-Dhirā' (الذراع).

#### The Encompassing of the Throne over the World

Know that the Throne encompassed the world due to its circularity, encompassing what it encompassed of the world. And in everything that it encompassed, circularity is manifest, even in generated things (المولدات). Look at the Prophet's, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, simile concerning the Footstool (الكرسي): that it is inside the Throne like a ring in a desert land. So he likened it to a circular shape, which is the ring and the land. Likewise, the heavens are likened to a ring in the Footstool, and the spherical Elements (الأركان الكرية) are likewise inside the lowest sphere. Furthermore, whatever is generated from them is never in its form except circular or tending toward circularity, whether mineral, plant, or animal. This is because movement is rotational, so it only yields what resembles it.

The Throne is the greatest of bodies in terms of encompassing, so it is the Magnificent Throne (العرش العظيم) in bulk and measure. And by its movement, it gave what was in its potential to those under its encompassing and grasp, so it is the Noble Throne (العرش الكريم) for that reason. And by its transcendence (نزاهة) from being encompassed by other bodies, it possessed honor, so it is the Glorious Throne (العرش المجيد).

Furthermore, the Name The All-Merciful (الرحمن) only established itself upon it because of the Breath of the All-Merciful (النفس الرحماني). This is because the encompassed entity is in distress due to its knowledge that it is encompassed in terms of its form. So the Breath of the All-Merciful gave it a spirit (روح) from His Command. Thus, the totality of every existent thing in the world was its form and its governing spirit. And He made its spirit neither inside the form nor outside it, because it is non-spatial (غير متحيز), thus negating both the conditioned and the condition. For the Soul (النفس) from which the spirits emanated is neither inside the world nor outside it.

When the existent thing considers its state of being encompassed, its breast tightens in terms of its form. But when it looks at itself in terms of its spirituality (روحانيته), Allah relieves that distress from it through its spirit, because it knows that its essence (ذات) is not described as being encompassed in the way the Throne encompasses forms, so the distress vanishes. And this bequeaths to it delight, joy, and happiness in its essence in terms of its spirit. For this reason, the Establishment (الاستواء) was by the Name The All-Merciful.

And the encompassing of this Throne is derived from the Divine Encompassing by Knowledge, in His saying: <<أَحَاطَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا>> (He encompasses all things in knowledge), and <<فَهُوَ مِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ مُحِيطٌ>> (He is encompassing them from behind). There is no target beyond Allah for an archer, and beyond the world is Allah, so He is the ultimate end, and He has no end. There is no god but He, the Almighty, the Wise.

The Word (الكلمة) in the Throne, derived from the Breath of the All-Merciful, is one, and it is the Divine Command for the creation of existents (الكائنات). The Breath (النفس) traveled to the limit of the Void, and by it everything became alive. For the Throne is upon the Water, so it accepted life by its essence. And Allah created from it <<كُلَّ شَيْءٍ حَيٍّ أَ فَلا يُؤْمِنُونَ>> (every living thing. Will they not then believe?)—referring to what they see of the life of the earth by rain and the life of trees by irrigation, even the air, which, if it did not contain moisture, would burn.

#### That the Throne has Pillars of Light

Know that Allah has made for this Throne pillars of light (قوائم نورانية). I do not know how many they are, but I witnessed them, and their light resembles the light of lightning. Despite this, I saw a shadow for it, containing comfort whose measure cannot be estimated. That shadow is the shadow of the concave side of this Throne, which screens the light of the One Established (المستوي), who is The All-Merciful.

And I saw the Treasure (الكنز) beneath the Throne, from which the phrase "There is no power and no strength except with Allah, the High, the Magnificent" emerged. Behold, the Treasure was Adam, peace be upon him. And I saw many treasures beneath him that I know. And I saw beautiful birds flying in its corners. I saw among them one of the most beautiful birds, and it greeted me and suggested that I take it with me to the lands of the East. I was in the city of Marrakesh when all this was unveiled to me. I asked, "Who is it?" I was told, "Muhammad al-Hassar in the city of Fez. He asked Allah for a journey to the lands of the East, so take him with you." I said, "Hearing and obedience." I said to him—and he was the entity of that bird—"You shall be my companion, if Allah wills." When I came to the city of Fez, I asked about him, and he came to me. I asked him, "Have you asked Allah for a need?" He said, "Yes, I asked Him to carry me to the lands of the East, and I was told that so-and-so would carry me, and I have been waiting for you since that time." So I took him as my companion in the year 597 AH and delivered him to the lands of Egypt, where he died, may Allah have mercy on him.

If you say: 'What about the angels surrounding the Throne? There is no void left for them to act in, as the Throne has occupied the Void.' We say: There is no difference between their surrounding the Throne and the Establishment upon the Throne, for He who does not accept spatial limitation (التحيز) does not accept connection or separation. Furthermore, the angels surrounding the Throne are not surrounding this body that occupied the Void. Rather, it is that Throne which Allah will bring forth for the separation and judgment on the Day of Resurrection (يوم القيامة). And this Throne upon which He established Himself is the Throne of the Name The All-Merciful. Have you not heard Him say: <<وَتَرَى الْمَلائِكَةَ حَافِّينَ مِنْ حَوْلِ الْعَرْشِ يُسَبِّحُونَ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّهِمْ وَقُضِيَ بَيْنَهُمْ بِالْحَقِّ وَقِيلَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ>> (And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [Allah] with praise of their Lord. And judgment will have been concluded between them in truth, and it will be said, 'Praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds')? This is on the Day of Resurrection. It will be borne by the eight angels, and that will be on the Plain of Gathering (أرض الحشر). And the ratio of the Throne to that land is like the ratio of Paradise (الجنة) to the width of the wall in the direction of prayer (قبلة) of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, while he was performing the eclipse prayer. This is one of the issues raised by Dhū al-Nūn al-Misrī concerning the introduction of the vast upon the narrow without the narrow being widened or the vast being narrowed. Whoever knows the loci (المواطن) finds hearing such things easy.

***

### Chapter Eighteen: Concerning the Divine Name The Thankful (الشكور)

And its direction toward the creation of the Footstool (الكرسي) and the two Feet (القدمين), and concerning the letters, the letter Kāf (ك), and the mansion of Al-Nathrah (النثرة). The Exalted said: <<وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّماواتِ وَالْأَرْضَ>> (His Footstool extends over the heavens and the earth).

#### The Divine Word divides into ruling and information

Some people of meanings (أهل المعاني) said it means Knowledge, and they transmitted this linguistically. However, in this verse, it is nothing but a perceptible body, which is in the Throne like a ring thrown in a desert, except that, like the Throne, it has no movement. From this Footstool, the Divine Word (الكلمة الإلهية) divides into ruling (حكم) and information (خبر). It is for the two Feet mentioned in the tradition (الخبر), just as the Throne is for the Establishment of the All-Merciful. And it has angels standing upon it who know nothing but the Lord, Exalted is He. For the container (ظرفية) of the Cloud (العماء) is for the Lord (الرب), the Throne is for the All-Merciful (الرحمن), and the Footstool is for the pronoun referring to Allah, Exalted is He. These three Names are the Mothers of the Names (أمهات الأسماء). If you trace the Noble Quran, you will find these three Names—Allah, The Lord, and The All-Merciful—circulating within it.

And He has a footstool between every heaven and heaven, besides this Greatest Footstool. And it is called 'attributed' (منسوب), meaning it is only intelligible in this way, unlike other existent things. From this comes the nature of The Lord (الرب), who is only intelligible when related (مضافاً). Others, which are the Names Allah and The All-Merciful, have appeared unrelated, but The Lord never appears except related, for He seeks the object of Lordship (المربوب) by His Essence: Our Lord, <<رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ>> (your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers), <<رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ>> (Lord of the heavens), <<رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ>> (Lord of the East). This reality thus affected the spatial level (المرتبة المكانية), which is the Footstool, so it appeared as attributed, and attribution is relation. And it came in the third degree, which is the first of the odd numbers.

Since The Lord is the Stable One (الثابت), the Divine Name ruled the Footstool with stability (الثبوت) likewise. The stability also described by the Throne announces that the Name The All-Merciful has a stable ruling over everything it contains, which is His saying: <<وَرَحْمَتِي وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ>> (And My Mercy encompasses all things). So everything inclines toward Mercy, even if the matter is interspersed with pains, punishment, ailments, and diseases, alongside the ruling of the Name The All-Merciful. These are merely accidents (أعراض) that occurred in the existents (الأكوان) of this world and the Hereafter. This is because The All-Merciful possesses the Most Beautiful Names (الأسماء الحسنى), and among the Names are The Harmful, The Humiliator, and The Giver of Death. For this reason, what Mercy does not necessitate appeared in the world, but due to accidents, and within the folds of those accidents is Mercy. Even if it were only the doubling of bliss and comfort following the removal of its ruling. For this reason, it was said: 'Sweeter than security to the fearful and anxious.' The pleasures of blessings are only known through their opposites. Thus, they were established for the acquisition of knowledge, in which lies the honor of humanity. So they were like the path leading, or the guide leading to its signified meaning, through direct experience (ذوقاً). And the attainment of knowledge through direct experience is more complete than through information. Do you not see that The Real described Himself through the tongues of His Messengers with Wrath and Satisfaction? And from these two realities appeared in the world the acquisition of knowledge from manifest experiences, like tastes and their likes, and inner experiences, like the pains of worries and sorrows, even with the soundness of the manifest limbs from any cause leading to pain. Look how wondrous this is!

So the Throne was stable due to the stability of the pervasive Mercy that <<وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ>> (encompasses all things). Thus, it possesses encompassing, and it is the very entity of the Breath of the All-Merciful (النفس الرحماني). By it, Allah relieves every distress (كرب) in His creation. For the distress that occurs or is found by the world is due to their origin being in the Grip (القبضة), and everything gripped is confined, and everything confined is restricted. And when the human was created upon the Form, he could not bear the restriction. So Allah relieved him of what he found of that through this Breath of the All-Merciful, just as His breathing out (تنفسه) was from the ruling of Love by which He described Himself in His saying: "I loved to be known." So He manifested it in the Breath of the All-Merciful, and that Divine Breathing Out was the very entity of the world's existence. Thus, the world knew Him as He willed. So the entity of the world is the entity of Mercy, and nothing else. Sharpen your heart! How can the world be Mercy for The Real, yet The Real perpetuates pain upon it? Allah is too Generous and too Exalted for that.

Look how wondrous is what the station of the Footstool (مقام الكرسي) bestowed: the division of the Divine Word, whereby The Real and Creation appeared. They would not have been distinguished were it not for the Footstool, which is the place of the two Feet mentioned in the tradition. And through this Name, the letter Kāf (ك) was found in the Human Soul, and the mansion of Al-Nathrah (النثرة) in the Sphere of Mansions, when its sphere was found.

### Chapter Nineteen: Concerning the Name The Self-Sufficient (الغني)

And its direction toward the creation of the Atlas Sphere (الفلك الأطلس), which is the Sphere of Constellations (فلك البروج), and its seeking aid from the Name Time/Eternity (الدهر), and the creation of the letter Jīm (ج) from the letters, and Al-Tarf (الطرف) from the Mansions.

#### That Self-Sufficiency made the Sphere Atlas, uniform in parts, and circular in shape.

Know that this Name made this sphere Atlas, having no stars, uniform in parts, and circular in shape, whose movement has no known beginning or end. It has no limit (طرف). Through its existence, the seven days, months, and years came into being. But these times were only specified within it after Allah created the signs in its interior that distinguished these times. This sphere only specified one day from them, which is one rotation specified by the place of the Foot (القدم) on the Footstool. So it was specified from above, and that measure is called a day. Only Allah, Exalted is He, knew this day, due to the uniformity of the parts of this sphere and the first beginning of its movement. The beginning of its movement and the first degree of the Gemini constellation (برج الجوزاء) faced this Foot, and it is one of the airy constellations. So the first day that appeared in the world was at the first degree of Gemini, and that day is called Sunday (الأحد). When that part of the sphere specified by Allah reached the position corresponding to that Foot on the Footstool, one rotation—the totality—was completed. All parts of this sphere corresponded to the place of the Foot on the Footstool, so that movement encompassed every degree, minute, second, and what is above that in this sphere. Thus, spaces (الأحياز) appeared, and the existence of the spatial, indivisible individual substance (الجوهر الفرد المتحيز) was established from the movement of this sphere.

Then, at this end, it began another transference in the center as well, until it reached the limit, like the first movement, with all the individual parts it is composed of, because it possesses quantities. This second movement is called Monday (الإثنين), until seven rotational movements were completed. Each movement was specified by a Divine Attribute (صفة إلهية), and the Attributes are seven, no more than that. Thus, Time (الدهر) could not increase the days beyond seven, for there is nothing that necessitates it. So the ruling returned to the first Attribute, which rotated it, and the Name Sunday (الأحد) continued to apply to it. Considering the rotations, it should have been the eighth, but since its existence was derived from the first Attribute, its name did not change. And so on for the rotation that follows, up to seven rotations. Then the ruling begins again as it was the first time, derived from that Attribute, and that Name follows it for all eternity, in this world and the Hereafter, by the ruling of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

Sunday (الأحد) is from the Attribute of Hearing (السمع). For this reason, there is nothing in the world except that which hears the Divine Command in its state of non-existence, by His saying "Be!" (كن). Monday (الإثنين): its movement was found from the Attribute of Life (الحياة), and by it, life came into the world. There is no part of the world except that it is living. Tuesday (الثلاثاء): its movement was found from the Attribute of Sight (البصر). There is no part of the world except that it witnesses its Creator in terms of its own entity, not in terms of the entity of its Creator. Wednesday (الأربعاء): its movement was found from the Attribute of Will (الإرادة). There is no part of the world except that it intends the glorification of its Originator. Thursday (الخميس): its movement was found from the Attribute of Power (القدرة). There is no part of Existence except that it is capable of praising its Originator. Friday (الجمعة): its movement was found from the Attribute of Knowledge (العلم). There is no part of the world except that it knows its Originator in terms of its own essence, not in terms of the Essence of its Originator. It was said that it was found from the Attribute of Knowledge on Wednesday, and that is correct, for he meant the knowledge of the entity, which is the knowledge of witnessing (المشاهدة). What we intended is Divine Knowledge absolutely, not acquired knowledge. This statement we related as having been said was not said to me by any human, but by a spirit (روح) among the spirits. I answered it with this reply, and it paused, and then it was revealed to it that the matter was as we mentioned. Saturday (السبت): its movement was found from the Attribute of Speech (الكلام). There is no part of Existence except that it glorifies (يسبح) the praise of its Creator, but we do not understand its glorification. <<إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ حَلِيمًا غَفُورًا>> (Indeed, Allah is ever Forbearing, Forgiving).

There is no part of the world except that it speaks the glorification of its Creator, knowing what it glorifies Him with, which is fitting for His Majesty, capable of that, and intending it specifically, not for any other reason. Whoever exists due to witnessing the greatness of his Originator is alive in heart and hearing of His Command. So the days were specified to be seven for these Attributes and their rulings. Thus, the world appeared Living, Hearing, Seeing, Knowing, Willing, Powerful, Speaking. So His work is according to His disposition, as the Exalted said: <<قُلْ كُلٌّ يَعْمَلُ عَلى‏ شاكِلَتِهِ>> (Say: Everyone acts according to his own disposition). And the world is His work, so it appeared with the Attributes of The Real. If you say concerning it that it is The Real, you speak truly, for Allah said: <<وَلَكِنَّ اللَّهَ رَمَى>> (But Allah threw). And if you say concerning it that it is creation, you speak truly, for He said: <<إِذْ رَمَيْتَ>> (When you threw). So He stripped and clothed, affirmed and negated. Thus, He is not it, and He is it; He is the Unknown Known. <<وَلِلَّهِ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَى>> (And to Allah belong the Most Beautiful Names), and for the world is the manifestation of them through ethical transformation (التخلق). Thus, the seven days are neither increased nor decreased. Only the world above the Atlas Sphere knows these days as we have explained them, because they witnessed the Divine Directions (التوجهات الإلهيات) from there toward the creation of these cycles, and they distinguished between the Directions, so they were confined to seven. Then the ruling returned, and they knew the end of that. As for those beneath this sphere, they only knew that through the seven wandering stars (الجواري السبعة), and they only knew the specification of the day through the sphere of the Sun, where the Sun divided it into night and day, so night and day specified the day.

Then Allah, Exalted is He, placed in this Atlas Sphere the ruling of division that appeared in the Footstool, when the Word divided within it due to the lowering of the two Feet toward it, which are information (خبر) and ruling (حكم). And the ruling has five divisions: obligation (وجوب), prohibition (حظر), permissibility (إباحة), recommendation (ندب), and dislike (كراهة). And information is one division, which is what does not fall under any one of these rulings. If you multiply two by six, the total is twelve: six Divine and six cosmic, because they are upon the Form. So this Atlas Sphere divided into twelve parts, specified by the division of the Word in the Footstool that we mentioned. And He gave each part a ruling in the world, terminating at a limit, and then they rotate just as the days rotate, without end.

He gave one part of them twelve thousand years, which is the part of Aries (الحمل). Every year has three hundred and sixty rotations, multiplied by twelve thousand. Whatever total results from that is the ruling of this part in the world, by the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing, which Allah revealed concerning the Divine Command existing in the world. Then it proceeds through every part by dropping one thousand [years] until it reaches the last part, which is Pisces (الحوت), which follows Aries. The operation in every part is by calculation, like the operation we mentioned for Aries. Whatever total results from that is the limit. Then the cycle returns as it began: <<كَمَا بَدَأَكُمْ تَعُودُونَ>> (As He originated you, you will return).

The moving thing has a stable entity (عين), and what is renewed is only the movement. Movement never returns as the same entity, but as its similitude. And the entity never ceases to exist, for Allah has decreed its permanence, since He loved to be known, and thus the entities of the knowers (العارفين)—who are the parts of the world—must be preserved.

This sphere is the roof of Paradise (الجنة), and from its movement, what is formed in Paradise is formed. Its order is never broken. Paradise never perishes in its essence, and its bliss is never interspersed with pain or disturbance. Even though the natures of the parts of this sphere are different, they only differed because Nature (الطبيعة) is above it, and ruled over it with what it yields of heat, coldness, dryness, and moisture. However, since it is composite and not simple, the ruling of Nature only appeared in it through composition. So the fiery composition of these parts is from heat and dryness; the earthy composition is from coldness and dryness; the airy composition is from heat and moisture; and the watery composition is from coldness and moisture. Thus, they appeared in four levels, because Nature only accepts four compositions from them, due to them being equally opposed and non-opposed. Therefore, it only accepted four compositions, just as it is in its entity, four and no more, even though Nature is fundamentally two, because it originates from the Soul (النفس).

#### That the Soul has two powers

The Soul possesses two powers: cognitive (علمية) and operative (عملية). Thus, Nature possesses two realities that are active without knowledge. It acts by the knowledge of the Soul, not by its own knowledge, for it has no knowledge. Yet it possesses knowledge. It is active by nature, but not described by knowledge. Thus, in terms of heat and coldness, it is active. Then dryness was affected by heat, and moisture by coldness. Just as heat opposes coldness, the effect of heat opposes the effect of coldness. For this reason, only four compositions resulted from the totality. Their ruling appeared in the parts of this sphere by the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

Then He made them based on triplicity (التثليث): every third is four. If you multiply three by four, the total is twelve. So every constellation has three faces (وجوه). Multiplied by four constellations, the total is twelve faces. And the four constellations have encompassed the composition of the temperaments, because they are confined to fiery, earthy, airy, and watery. If you multiply three levels by twelve faces, the total is thirty-six faces, which is a tenth of the degrees—that is, one part in ten. And ten is the final limit of the ages (الأحقاب), and the age (حقبة) is the year. So I hope that the outcome will be toward the Mercy of Allah, in whatever abode He wills, for the intention is that Mercy encompasses everyone, wherever they are, so that He gives life to all after some were in a state of neither dying nor living, which is the state of the Isthmus (البرزخ).

#### That the Footstool is the place of the two Feet

Know that this sphere, by its movement, intersects the Footstool, just as the spheres below it intersect it. Since the Footstool is the place of the two Feet, it only yielded two abodes in the Hereafter: Fire (نار) and Paradise (جنة). For by the two Feet, it yielded two spheres: the Sphere of Constellations and the Sphere of Mansions, which is the land of Paradise, and both remain. And what is below the Sphere of Mansions—its order will be destroyed, its form changed, and the light of its stars removed, as He said: <<يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ الْأَرْضُ غَيْرَ الْأَرْضِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ>> (The Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens), and He said: <<فَإِذَا النُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ>> (And when the stars are obliterated). Only the known heavens were mentioned—the seven heavens specifically. As for the concave side of the Sphere of Mansions, it is the roof of the Fire (جهنم).

From the action of these two Feet in this sphere, there appeared in the world <<مِنْ كُلٍّ زَوْجَيْنِ اثْنَيْنِ>> (two pairs of everything), by the decree of the Almighty, due to the existence of the ruling of the two active principles of Nature, the two powers of the Soul, the two faces of the Intellect, and the two letters of the Divine Word 'Be!' (كن)—from the two Divine Attributes in <<لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَيْءٌ>> (There is nothing like unto Him), which is the single Attribute, and <<وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْبَصِيرُ>> (And He is the Hearing, the Seeing), which is the other Attribute. So whoever affirms Transcendence (تنزيه) does so from <<لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَيْءٌ>>, and whoever affirms Analogy (تشبيه) does so from <<وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْبَصِيرُ>>. Thus, Unseen (غيب) is Transcendence, and Witnessing (شهادة) is Analogy. Understand, if you are capable of understanding.

Know what Reality ruled over the dualists (الثنوية) so that they committed polytheism—namely, the Manichaeans (المانية)—despite their exhaustive speculation and utmost effort in it. They were unable to exit this duality (اثنينية) into the Single Entity (العين الواحدة). And there is nothing there except Allah. <<وَمَنْ يَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَهًا آخَرَ لَا بُرْهَانَ لَهُ بِهِ>> (And whoever invokes another god with Allah, for which he has no proof), he is not excused, because he descended from this degree and resorted to imitation (تقليد). Thus, the master of speculation (صاحب النظر) was saved, and the imitator perished. For he relied upon a verified matter in the Attribute and the Word: <<وَأَضَلَّهُ اللَّهُ عَلَى عِلْمٍ>> (And Allah led him astray upon knowledge), and <<وَخَتَمَ عَلَى سَمْعِهِ>> (and sealed his hearing), so he did not hear <<وَإِلَهُكُمْ إِلَهٌ وَاحِدٌ>> (And your God is one God). And He sealed his heart, so he did not know that He is one God, because he did not witness the turning of his heart. And <<وَجَعَلَ عَلَى بَصَرِهِ غِشَاوَةً>> (and placed a covering over his sight), so he did not grasp the singularity (فردية) of the Word [Kun] by the Wāw (و) between the Kāf (ك) and the Nūn (ن). The covering prevented him from grasping it, so he only witnessed two: the Kāf and the Nūn, verbally and graphically.

And the Kāf is two Kāfs: the Kāf of 'Be!' (كن), which is the Kāf of affirmation (الإثبات), and the Kāf of 'was not' (لم يكن), which is the Kāf of negation (النفي). In this Kāf, the sun rose for us in the year 590 AH, so we affirmed the negation of Analogy (التشبيه) by the rising of the sun in 'was not.' And whoever did not have the sun rise for him in it affirmed Nullification (التعطيل). Yet the sun is rising, and necessarily so, in 'was not': half of its disk is manifest, and half is concealed within it. The covering prevented this viewer from grasping its rising, so he affirmed Nullification, which is absolute negation. There is no speculator except that he has an excuse, and Allah is too Exalted to burden a soul beyond its capacity.

> So all of them abide eternally in the Mercy of Allah,
> Whether His unifier, or the one with a partner, or the denier.

And from this Name, the letter Jīm (ج) and Al-Tarf (الطرف) from the Mansions were found. The discussion of each of these letters and Mansions will come in its respective chapter.

### Chapter Twenty: Concerning the Name The Determiner (المقدر)

And its direction toward the creation of the Sphere of Mansions (فلك المنازل) and the Gardens (الجنات), and the determination (تقدير) of the forms of the stars in the concave side of this sphere, and its being the land of Paradise and the roof of Hell (جهنم). And for it is the letter Shīn (ش) from the letters, and the mansion of the Lion's Forehead (جبهة الأسد). The Exalted said: <<وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ ... ذَلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ>> (And the moon—We have determined for it phases... That is the determination of the Almighty, the All-Knowing).

The Mansions (المنازل) are the measures of the divisions in the Sphere of Constellations, which The Real specified for us, since sight did not distinguish it, by means of these Mansions. And He made them twenty-eight mansions because of the letters of the Breath of the All-Merciful (النفس الرحماني). We only said this because people imagine that the twenty-eight letters derive their number from the Mansions, but with us, it is the reverse: the ruling of the number of Mansions came from these letters.

And they were made twenty-eight, divided among twelve constellations, so that each constellation would have a share in the whole number and a share in the fraction. For if a constellation had a whole number without a fraction, or a fraction without a whole number, the ruling of that constellation would not be comprehensive in the world, due to the ruling of increase, decrease, perfection, and lack of perfection. Increase and decrease are necessary, because equilibrium (الاعتدال) is impossible, for the world is founded upon formation (التكوين), and formation is not valid with equilibrium. Thus, there must be a fraction and a whole number in every constellation. So each constellation had two and one-third mansions.

Thus, there is a constellation that has two whole mansions and one-third of a mansion as a fraction. And there is a constellation that has one whole mansion in the middle, and a fraction at its end and a fraction at its beginning, so a whole mansion of mixed temperament (مزاج) and one-third of a mansion are patched together from the two fractions. We only said 'mixed temperament' because every mansion has a specific temperament. When a part of one mansion is combined with two parts of another mansion to complete the entity of a mansion—because the mansion is tripartite, just as the constellation has three faces. And from the faces of its mansions are seven faces. So every constellation has seven faces, and it has three faces from itself, making the total ten faces. The whole mansion has a single temperament, while the mansion composed of two mansions is like the offspring of two, for which a new temperament arises that is not present in either parent. In this is a wondrous secret, which is the oneness of the totality (أحدية المجموع), for it has an effect that the oneness of the single entity does not possess. Do you not see that the world only came into existence through the oneness of the totality, and the Self-Sufficiency (الغني) of Allah was only established through the oneness of the single entity? This ruling undoubtedly contradicts that ruling.

Al-Thurayyā (The Pleiades) has a specific temperament. Aries (الحمل) took one-third of it. Then Taurus (الثور) came, needing two and one-third mansions. It took the mansion of Al-Dabarān whole, with a single, unified temperament. There remained for it one and one-third mansions, but it found no whole mansion to take. So it took two-thirds of Al-Thurayyā and added to that two-thirds of Al-Haq'ah (الهقعة), completing one mansion for it through the oneness of the totality. This mansion gives it the very ruling of Al-Thurayyā and the very ruling of Al-Haq'ah. Then it takes the second third of Al-Haq'ah, so it only acts from Al-Haq'ah through the middle third. As for the first third added to the two-thirds of Al-Thurayyā to complete the mansion, a ruling arises for this third, and a ruling arises for the third of Al-Thurayyā, with the perfection and form of a mansion that is not the single entity of either of them—a ruling that belongs neither to two-thirds of one nor to the third of the other.

This is the reason why the constellation has three faces: some are pure constellations, and some are mixed constellations. And are all constellations composed of two-thirds and two-thirds? These are known constellations that the division of the Mansions specifies for you. The composite mansion may arise from a fortunate (سعيدة) and an unfortunate (نحسة) mansion, so the totality yields fortune, and the effect of the misfortune of the other does not appear. Or it may yield misfortune, and the effect of the fortune of the other does not appear. This is unlike the whole mansion, which proceeds according to what it was created for. For Allah gave it its creation, just as He gave the composite its creation. Every sign and indication concerning a constellation must involve composition, and it must be by triplicity (التثليث). For the evidence (الدليل) is always tripartite in origin; this is necessary: two singular premises and a connector between them, which is the third face. This is necessary in every two premises for the sake of production (الإنتاج). Every A is B, and every B is C. The B is repeated, so the evidence arises from A, B, C. The connecting face is B, because it was repeated in the two premises, and it produced 'Every A is C,' which was the claim of the claimant. He claimed that every A is C, and he was disputed, so he presented the evidence with what the disputant admitted: he conceded that every A is B, and he conceded that every B is C. Thus, the correctness of the claimant's statement that every A is C was established with him. From this, proofs (البراهين) appeared in the human world. And from these divisions that the Mansions gave in the Constellations, and after you have known this:

#### That the Footstool and the Throne are above the Atlas Sphere.

Know that when the Atlas Sphere (الفلك الأطلس) had the Footstool (الكرسي) established for it in the position of the Throne (العرش)—and above the Atlas Sphere are the Footstool and the Throne—these three gave existence to the Sphere of the Lunar Mansions (فلك المنازل), just as premises composed of three elements yield a conclusion. And just as the conclusion carries the powers of the three elements present in the two premises, so too does the Sphere of the Stars (فلك الكواكب) carry the power of the Atlas Sphere, the Footstool, and the Throne.

The Footstool (الكرسي) is the comprehensive aspect (الوجه الجامع) between the two premises because it is the intermediary between the Throne and the Atlas Sphere, having an aspect facing each of them. From the power of the Throne, the Divine Word (الكلمة الإلهية) became unified or attained Oneness (توحدت) within it. Thus, the inhabitants of Paradise, who are the people of this Starry Sphere (الفلك المكوكب), say to a thing, "Be," and it is. From the power of the Footstool, every human being in it has two wives, because it is the place of the two feet. And from the power of the Atlas Sphere (الفلك الأطلس), his humanity (إنسانيته) was annihilated (غابت) in his Lord, so things came into being through him, though they only come into being through Allah. And the Lordship (الربوبية) was annihilated in his humanity, so he found pleasure in things, enjoyed bliss, ate, drank, and married. Thus, he is a creature (خلق) who is also the Real (حق), yet he is unknown, just as the Atlas Sphere is unknown.

For this reason, we said that this Sphere has acquired the power of what is above it, because it is derived from it. Similarly, everything below it—the generated entity (المولد) always gathers the realities (حقائق) of what is above it, until it culminates in the Human (الإنسان), who is the last generated entity. In him are gathered the powers of the entire Cosmos (العالم) and the Divine Names (الأسماء الإلهية) in their completeness. Therefore, there is no existent being more perfect than the Perfect Human (الإنسان الكامل). Whoever among mankind does not attain perfection in this world is merely a rational animal (حيوان ناطق), a part of the form and nothing more. He does not reach the degree of the Human. Rather, his relation to the Human is like the relation of a dead body to a living human. He is human in shape, but not in Reality (الحقيقة). For the dead body, in the eye of perception, lacks all powers. Likewise, this is true for the one who has not attained perfection. His perfection is achieved through Vicegerency (الخلافة). No one can be a Vicegerent (خليفة) except one who possesses the Divine Names (الأسماء الإلهية) by way of inherent qualification (الاستحقاق)—meaning he is upon a specific composition (تركيب خاص) that accepts them, since not every composition accepts them. This is one of the Divine Secrets (الأسرار الإلهية) that intellects deem permissible, yet their actual existence is impossible [for the intellect to grasp].

When Allah created this Sphere, He formed Paradise (الجنة) upon its surface. Its surface is musk, and it is the earth of Paradise. He divided the Gardens (الجنات) into three sections corresponding to the three aspects of every mansion (برج): the Gardens of Special Distinction (جنات الاختصاص), which are the first; the Gardens of Inheritance (جنات الميراث), which are the second; and the Gardens of Deeds (جنات الأعمال), which are the third. Then He placed in each section four rivers, multiplied by three, resulting in twelve rivers. From these, twelve springs appeared in the rock of Moses for the twelve tribes: <<قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُناسٍ مَشْرَبَهُمْ>> (Each group knew its drinking place). The first river is the river of water, which is *ghayr āsin* (غير آسن), meaning it is unchanging, and this is the Knowledge of Life (علم الحياة). The second is the river of wine (الخمر), which is the Knowledge of Spiritual States (علم الأحوال). The third is the river of honey (العسل), which is the Knowledge of Revelation (علم الوحي) in its various forms. This is why the angels swoon (تصعق) when they hear the Revelation, just as a wine drinker becomes intoxicated. The fourth is the river of milk (اللبن), which is the Knowledge of Secrets (علم الأسرار) and the core essence (اللب) produced by spiritual disciplines (الرياضات) and piety (التقوى).

These are four types of knowledge. The human being has a threefold origination (مثلث النشأة): an inner, spiritual, and subtle origination (نشأة باطنة معنوية روحانية); an outer, sensory, and natural origination (نشأة ظاهرة حسية طبيعية); and an intermediate, bodily, imaginal, and Isthmus-like origination (نشأة متوسطة جسدية برزخية مثالية). Each origination has a share of these rivers; each share is an independent river whose taste varies according to the origination. Thus, one perceives through the senses what one does not perceive through the Imagination (الخيال), and one perceives through the Imagination what one does not perceive through the Intellect/Meaning (المعنى). This applies to every origination. Therefore, the human has twelve rivers: four in the Garden of Special Distinction, four in the Garden of Inheritance, and four in the Garden of Deeds—for whoever possesses a Garden of Deeds, whether through his own actions or through actions gifted to him by others. The human being thus acquires knowledge in every Garden according to the Reality (حقيقة) of that Garden and according to the source of the originations (مأخذ النشآت) within him, for their sources differ, the types of knowledge differ, and the Gardens differ, resulting in a difference in spiritual tastes (الأذواق).

The Breath of the All-Merciful (نفس الرحمن) is perpetual therein and never ceases, driven by a wind called *al-Muthīra* (The Exciter). In Paradise, there is a tree, called *al-Mu'nisa* (The Intimate Companion), such that no house in Paradise remains without a branch of it entering it. The inhabitants of Paradise gather at its base in its shade, conversing about what is appropriate to the Majesty (جلال) of Allah, according to their spiritual stations (مقاماتهم), by way of mutual benefit. Consequently, each person gains knowledge he did not previously possess, and his rank (منزلته) rises with the elevation of that knowledge. When they rise from beneath that tree, they find degrees (درجات) and stations (منازل) in their Gardens that they had not known before. They find a pleasure in them whose measure cannot be estimated. They are astonished and do not know the source of this. Then the wind *al-Muthīra*, from the Breath of the All-Merciful, blows upon them, informing them: "These degrees you have attained are your stations within the stations of the knowledge you acquired beneath the tree *al-Mu'nisa* in your gathering place. These are its stations." Thus, each person attains a station that he knows. Not a single breath passes for them except that they have new, everlasting bliss (نعيم مقيم جديد) in it.

This is what the surface of this Sphere contains, along with similar things. These Gardens were created under the ascendant of Leo (الأسد), which is a fixed sign (برج ثابت). Thus, they possess permanence, and Leo possesses dominance (القهر). For this reason, its inhabitants say to a thing, "Be," and it cannot refuse except to be, because there is no sign among the mansions that possesses such might. It has the dominance to bring things forth from non-existence (العدم) into Existence (الوجود).

As for the concave (مقعر) of this Sphere, Allah made it the location for the fixed stars (الكواكب الثابتة) that traverse the Sphere of the Zodiacal Signs (فلك البروج). They have 1,021 forms therein, plus the forms of the seven wandering stars (الجواري) in the seven heavens. The total number of forms is 1,028, all traversing the Sphere of the Zodiacal Signs, some fast and some slow. The day of each star is measured by its period of traversing the Sphere of the Zodiacal Signs. The fastest in traversing is the Moon, whose day is twenty-eight days of the Great Cycle (الدورة الكبرى) by which these days are measured—these being the days known to people, as the Exalted One indicated in His saying: <<وَإِنَّ يَوْماً عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ كَأَلْفِ سَنَةٍ مِمَّا تَعُدُّونَ>> (Indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of what you count). This refers to these known days. The shortest day among these stars is the day of the Moon, its measure being twenty-eight days of what you count. The longest day for one of these stars is thirty-six thousand years of what you count. The day of the Divine Name *Dhū al-Ma'ārij* (Possessor of the Ascending Stairways) is fifty thousand years, and the day of the Name *al-Rabb* (The Lord) is <<كَأَلْفِ سَنَةٍ مِمَّا تَعُدُّونَ>> (like a thousand years of what you count). Every Divine Name has a day.

If you wish to know the total days of the forms of the stars—meaning their measure in known days—multiply 1,021 by 36,000 years. The result is the total count of the stars' days in known days, since the day of each one is 36,000 years. Then add to the total the days of the seven wandering stars (الجواري). The sum is the total. Then take this total and multiply it by the sum of the years of the Zodiacal Signs (سنى البروج) and the years resulting from multiplying 360 by itself. The final sum is the number of generated entities (الكوائن) in the world from the moment Allah created it until its end. Know this. The sum resulting from multiplying 360 by itself, plus the years of the Zodiacal Signs, is 207,600. Multiply the total number of the stars' days by this sum. This is the calculation for the stars whose time and measure were determined by the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing (العزيز العليم).

In the Hereafter, in the abode of Hell (جهنم), the ruling of the days of the stars located in the concave of this Sphere and the seven wandering stars remains, despite their dimming, extinction, and scattering. They give rise to events in Hell different from the events of their illumination, stability, and the movement of their spheres (أفلاكها) with them. These are 1,028 spheres, all of which vanish, leaving the stars themselves swimming, their lights extinguished. In the Hereafter, in Paradise, the ruling of the Zodiacal Signs and the ruling of the measures of the Intellect (العقل) remain, and through them, what occurs and is established in the Gardens comes to pass.

As for the White Musk Dune (كثيب المسك الأبيض) in the Garden of Eden (جنة عدن), where people gather for the Vision (الرؤية) on the Day of the Greatest Visit (يوم الزور الأعظم), which is Friday, its days are from the days of Allah’s Names, and neither I nor anyone else has knowledge of them, for Allah has Names He has kept exclusively in His hidden knowledge (علم غيبه), so their days are not known. Eden is among the Gardens like the Kaaba, the House of Allah, among the houses of men. The Greatest Visit therein is like the Friday Prayer, the Special Visit (الزور الخاص) is like the five daily prayers, and the Most Sincere, Most Special Visit (الزور الأخلص الأخص) is like the mosques in houses for supererogatory prayers. Thus, you visit the Real (الحق) according to the measure of your prayer, and you see Him according to the measure of your presence (حضورك). The minimum presence is the presence in the intention (النية) at the *Takbīr* (Allahu Akbar) and upon concluding the prayer. The greatest presence is maintaining that presence until the conclusion of the prayer, and everything in between, in every prayer. Here (in this world) is intimate conversation (مناجاة), and there (in the Hereafter) is witnessing (مشاهدة). Here are movements, and there is stillness. This Name is associated with the letter *Shīn* (ش) and the lunar mansion *al-Jabhah* (The Forehead).

### Chapter Twenty-One: Concerning the Name *al-Rabb* (The Lord)

And its orientation (توجهه) toward the creation of the First Heaven, the Frequented House (البيت المعمور), the Lote Tree (السدرة), the Intimate Friend (الخليل, i.e., Abraham), Saturday, the letter *Yā'* (ي) with two dots below, the lunar mansion *al-Khurtān*, and Saturn (*Kaywān*). Allah the Exalted said, commanding His Prophet: <<وَقُلْ رَبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْماً>> (And say: My Lord, increase me in knowledge). The increase in knowledge is sought only from *al-Rabb* (The Lord). For this reason, it appears in the possessive form (مضاف), due to the greater need of the knower (*al-'ālim*) for it than for other Names, because it is the Name for all benefits (المصالح). It is one of the three Mother Names, appearing as: *Rabbukum* (Your Lord), *Rabb Ābā'ikum* (The Lord of your fathers), *Rabb al-Samāwāt wa al-Ard* (The Lord of the heavens and the earth), *Rabb al-Mashāriq* (The Lord of the Easts), *al-Mashriqayn* (the two Easts), *al-Mashriq* (the East), and the Lord of the Wests, the West, and the two Wests. He is the One taken as a Trustee (Wakīl).

### The Name *al-Rabb*

This Name gave the Lote Tree (السدرة) its fruit (*nabq*), its greenery, and its light, derived from it and from the Name *Allah*. The Name *al-Raḥmān* (The All-Merciful) gave it its fragrance (عرفها) from His Breath (النفس), as He said concerning Paradise: *'arrafahā lahum* (He has made it known to them), meaning by the Breath (النفس) from *al-'arf* (fragrance/scent). From the Name *Allah* come its roots and its *Zaqqūm* (Hell-food) for the people of Hell.

Allah has covered this Lote Tree with the Light of Ipseity (نور الهوية), so no eye can reach the witnessing (مشاهدتها) of it to define or describe it. The light that clothes it is the light of the deeds of the servants. Its fruit (*nabq*) is equal to the number of the souls of the blessed, or rather, equal to the number of the deeds of the blessed; indeed, they are the very Fixed Entities (أعيان) of the deeds of the blessed. There is no palace or arch in the Garden of Deeds (جنة الأعمال) except that a branch of this Lote Tree enters it. On that branch, the fruit (*nabq*) is equal to the number of movements in the deed that this branch represents. There is no leaf on that branch except that it contains beauty commensurate with the servant's presence (حضر) with Allah during that deed. The leaves of the branch are equal to the number of breaths taken during that deed.

All the thorns of this Lote Tree are for the people of wretchedness (أهل الشقاء), and its roots are within them. The tree is one, but its roots yield the opposite of what its branches yield in every respect. Thus, everything we have described concerning the branches finds its opposite limit in the roots. This frequently occurs in the science of botany. It is related that Abu al-'Ala' Ibn Zuhr, who was among the most knowledgeable people in medicine, especially the science of herbs, and Abu Bakr Ibn al-Ṣā'igh, known as Ibn Bājjah, who was less knowledgeable than Ibn Zuhr in the science of herbs but superior to him in natural science, were riding one day. Ibn Bājjah imagined, in his presumption, that he was more knowledgeable than Ibn Zuhr in the science of herbs. They passed by an herb, and Ibn Zuhr said to his servant, "Cut us some of this herb," pointing to a specific one. The servant took a piece, twisted it in his hand, and brought it close to his nose as if inhaling it. Then Ibn Zuhr said to Abu Bakr, "Look how sweet the scent of this herb is." Abu Bakr inhaled it and immediately suffered a nosebleed. He tried everything available in his knowledge to stop the bleeding, but nothing helped, and he was close to perishing. Abu al-'Ala' smiled and said, "O Abu Bakr, have you failed?" He replied, "Yes." Abu al-'Ala' then told his servant, "Extract the roots of that herb for me." The servant brought them. He said to Abu Bakr, "Inhale these." Abu Bakr inhaled them, and the bleeding stopped. Thus, he recognized Ibn Zuhr's superiority over him in the science of herbs.

The people most blessed by this Lote Tree are the people of Jerusalem, just as the people most blessed by the Mahdi are the people of Kufa, and the people most blessed by the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) are the people of the Meccan Sanctuary, and the people most blessed by the Real (الحق) are the People of the Quran. When the people of bliss eat from this tree, rancor is removed from their breasts. Written upon its leaves is: *Subbūḥ, Quddūs, Rabb al-Malā'ikah wa al-Rūḥ* (Glorified, Holy, Lord of the Angels and the Spirit). The deeds of the children of Adam terminate at this Lote Tree, which is why it is called the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary (سدرة المنتهى). The Real (الحق) has a special, magnificent Theophany (تجلي خاص) therein that binds the beholder and bewilders the inner thought (الخاطر). Beside it is a platform, which is the seat of Gabriel (peace be upon him). It contains signs (آيات) that "no eye has seen, nor ear heard, nor has it occurred to the heart of man," as the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said concerning it: "It was covered by the Light of Allah with what covered it." No one can describe it; the beholder merely looks upon it and is overcome by astonishment.

Allah created in this heaven the Frequented House (البيت المعمور), called *al-Ḍirāḥ*. It is directly above the Kaaba, as mentioned in the tradition: "If a pebble were to fall from it, it would land upon the Kaaba." This House is in this heaven, and the heaven is stationary, having no movement. Therefore, the House does not shift from the direction of the Kaaba, because Allah made these heavens fixed and stable, serving us like the roof of a house. For this reason, He called it the Raised Roof (السقف المرفوع). However, in every heaven there is a sphere (فلك), which is generated by the swimming (سباحة) of the star of that heaven. The stars swim in their spheres; every star has a sphere, so the number of spheres equals the number of stars. The Exalted says: <<كُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ>> (All swim in an orbit). The bodies of the heavens are transparent bodies, and they are the dwelling place of the angels. Were it not for the swimming of the stars, the spheres would have no visible essence (عين) in the heavens. They are in the heavens like roads on the earth: they become roads by virtue of those who walk upon them. Thus, the heaven is earth in terms of its essence (عينها) and a road in terms of the movement upon it.

This House has two doors. Seventy thousand angels enter it every day, then exit through the door opposite it, never to return. They enter through the Eastern Gate because it is the gate of the manifestation of Lights (الأنوار), and they exit through the Western Gate because it is the gate of the veiling of the departing Lights. They thus enter the Unseen (الغيب), and no one knows where they settle. These angels are created by Allah every day from the River of Life (نهر الحياة), from the drops that fall when Gabriel shakes himself, for Allah has ordained for him a daily immersion in the River of Life. The inner thoughts (خواطر) of the children of Adam occur daily in the number of these angels. There is no person, believer or otherwise, who does not have seventy thousand inner thoughts occur to him every day, though only the People of Allah (أهل الله) are aware of them.

These angels who enter the Frequented House, upon exiting, meet with the angels whom Allah created from the inner thoughts of hearts. When they meet them, their remembrance (ذكرهم) is seeking forgiveness (*Istighfār*) until the Day of Resurrection. Whoever has a heart continuously filled with the remembrance of Allah (ذكر الله), the angels created from his inner thoughts are distinguished from the angels created from the thoughts of a heart that does not possess this station. Whether the thought is appropriate or inappropriate, all hearts were created from this House, and thus they remain perpetually frequented (معمورة). Every angel formed from an inner thought is exactly in the image of that thought.

Allah created a star in this heaven, revealed His command (أمرها) within it, and settled Abraham the Intimate Friend (إبراهيم الخليل) therein. He gave this star a movement in its sphere according to a known measure. One of the most astonishing issues is the issue of these movements, for it belongs to the hidden knowledge (خفي العلم). It implies that it is not impossible for an entity to be affected by two influences simultaneously. Such movement for this star results from two different rulings (حكمين): a compulsory ruling (حكم قسري) and a volitional or natural ruling (حكم إرادي أو طبيعي). There is a clear example of this: If an animal is upon a body, intending a direction with its movement, and that body moves in a different direction, the animal moves in the direction of the body's movement along with its own movement in the opposite direction. Thus, it combines two opposing movements simultaneously in one time. It traverses the body it is upon, and the body traverses another body with it, so the animal traverses the second body by way of dependence (التبعية). For example, an ant on a cloth laid on the ground walks eastward upon it, while someone pulls that cloth westward. The ant is moving eastward at the very moment it is moving westward due to the movement of the cloth. This latter movement is a compulsory movement (حركة قهرية) dominating it. These are two opposing movements in a single instant.

Consider whether the combination of opposites (اجتماع الضدين) exists in this issue or not. The stars traverse the sphere, in plain sight, from West to East, while the encompassing Greater Sphere (الفلك الأكبر المحيط) traverses them from East to West. Thus, the star is moving from East to West at the very moment it is moving from West to East. The sphere generated by its eastward movement is the very essence (عين) of the sphere generated by its westward movement. This is like the issue of compulsion (*Jabr*) within the very essence of choice (*Ikhtiyār*): the servant is compelled in his choice. From this issue, you understand to whom the acts of the servants are attributed by the ruling of creation (حكم الخلق): Is one of the capable agents (القادرين) solely responsible for them, or do they belong to multiple capable agents, with each capable agent having a specific proportion therein, by which the religious obligation (*Taklīf*) occurs, and for the sake of which there is punishment and reward?

We have mentioned the effect of this Sphere upon the hearts of the Gnostics (العارفين), and others have mentioned it. We have also mentioned its effect upon the world of creation (عالم الخلق) in terms of generation and corruption (الكون والفساد)—which is the world of elements (الأركان) and generated entities (المولدات). All of this stems from the Breath of the All-Merciful (النفس الرحماني), because it imparts movements, and movement is the cause of Existence (الوجود). Do you not see that, fundamentally, were it not for the orientation of the Will (الإرادة)—which is a subtle, spiritual movement—and the Word (القول)—which is a subtle, spiritual movement, and by which the utterance (*lafẓah*) is named due to this movement—no existence would have manifested?

From this Sphere, Allah granted the existence of Saturday (يوم السبت), which is the Day of Eternity (يوم الأبد). Its night in the Hereafter has no end, and its day in the second abode (المحل الثاني) also has no end. The seven days are generated within it, including Saturday itself. This is also one of the most astonishing matters: that the days, of which Saturday is one, are generated on Saturday. Thus, it is one of the days, and yet the days manifest within it. This has a basis in the Divine Reality (الحقيقة الإلهية). Al-Tirmidhī narrated in *Gharīb al-Ḥisān* from Abū Hurayrah, who related that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "When Allah created Adam and breathed the Spirit (الروح) into him, he sneezed. The Real (الحق) said to him, 'Say *Al-Ḥamdu Lillāh* (Praise be to Allah).' So he said, *Al-Ḥamdu Lillāh*, praising Allah by His permission. He [Allah] said to him, 'May your Lord have mercy on you, O Adam. For this I created you.' (This addition is not from Al-Tirmidhī.) Then, returning to Al-Tirmidhī's hadith: 'O Adam, go to those angels, to a group of them sitting, and say, *Al-Salāmu 'alaykum* (Peace be upon you).' They replied, 'And upon you be peace and the mercy of Allah.' Then he returned to his Lord, who said, 'This is your greeting and the greeting between you and them.' Then Allah said to him, while His two Hands were closed, 'Choose whichever you wish.' He said, 'I choose the Hand of my Lord, and both Hands of my Lord are blessed Right Hands.' He opened them, and behold, Adam and his progeny were within them." Thus, Adam was within that grasp while simultaneously being outside of it. This is the very essence (عين) of this issue. If you reflect, you will find the Cosmos (العالم) in relation to the Real (الحق) in this perplexing state: He is it, yet He is not it. <<وَمَا رَمَيْتَ إِذْ رَمَيْتَ وَلَكِنَّ اللهَ رَمَى>> (And you did not throw when you threw, but Allah threw). He concluded with that with which He began. I wish I knew who the intermediary (الوسط) is, for he is the intermediary between negation, which is His saying <<وَمَا رَمَيْتَ>> (And you did not throw), and affirmation, which is His saying <<وَلَكِنَّ اللهَ رَمَى>> (but Allah threw). And that intermediary is His saying: "You are not, when you are, but Allah is you." This is the meaning of our discussion concerning the Manifest (الظاهر) and the Manifestations (المظاهر): that the Manifestation is the very essence (عين) of the Manifest, despite the difference in the forms of the Manifestations. Thus, we say concerning Zayd that he is one, despite the difference in his limbs. His foot is not his hand, yet it is Zayd when we say "Zayd." Likewise, all his limbs, his inner being (باطنه), his outer being (ظاهره), his Unseen (غيبه), and his Witnessed (شهادته) are different forms, yet he is the very essence of Zayd, not other than Zayd. Then every form is attributed to him and confirmed by the essence (*al-'ayn*), the self (*al-nafs*), the whole (*al-kull*), and the totality (*al-jam'*).

In this Sphere is the essence of death (عين الموت), the source of rest, and swift movement within stability, as well as the casting off of adornment and harm. This star was placed in the sign of Leo (برج الأسد), which is its opposite in nature but its counterpart in fixity. From this, one can discern whether the saying of those who claim that two similar things are opposites is mistaken or correct. When the star descends into the sign, does the ruling (الحكم) blend, so that the composite has a ruling different from what each possesses individually? Or does the ruling of the mansion and the sign dominate the star descending into it? Or does the ruling of the star dominate the sign? Or is one characterized by a greater degree of the ruling and the other by a lesser degree, while both rulings exist? In our view, neither one rules over the other. Rather, the ruling of their combined totality (جمعيتهم) manifests in the entity being ruled. Each of them has a power in that entity subject to that ruling, because that ruling originated from both of them through a state called conjunction (*al-ijtimā'*)—just as occurs in the conjunctions between stars. This is a type of conjunction, though it is not a true conjunction, but rather a descent into a mansion.

***

### Chapter Twenty-Two: Concerning the Name *al-'Alīm* (The All-Knowing)

And its orientation toward the creation of the Second Heaven, its hidden star (*khānis*), Thursday, Moses (peace be upon him), the letter *Ḍād* (ض), and the lunar mansion *al-Ṣarfah*. Allah the Exalted said, commanding His Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him): <<وَقُلْ رَبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْماً>> (And say: My Lord, increase me in knowledge). The discussion concerning the existence of this heaven and the rest of the heavens and spheres is as previously stated, except that I will point out the specific ruling (الحكم) unique to each heaven. As for this heaven, Allah revealed His command (أمرها) within it. The detailed explanation of the command of every heaven is lengthy, but we have mentioned a good portion of it in *Al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyyah*.

Part of its command is the life of the hearts of the scholars through knowledge, gentleness, kindness, and all noble character traits. For this reason, none of the inhabitants of the heavens among the spirits of the Prophets (peace be upon them) alerted the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) on the night Allah obligated fifty prayers upon his community, except Moses (peace be upon him). He said to him, "Go back to your Lord," because he was more knowledgeable about these matters due to his direct experience (*dhawq*) of similar situations with the Children of Israel and the trials he faced from them. Thus, he spoke from direct experience and expertise. Therefore, any Shaykh who speaks about the sciences based on direct experience (*dhawq*) and Divine Theophany (مجلى إلهي), and not merely from books and transmission, is a true scholar and master. Were it not for Moses, the obligation upon us would have been fifty prayers, despite the fact that Allah sent him as a mercy to the worlds. Whoever has many obligations imposed upon him has less mercy shown to him. So, Allah destined Moses (peace be upon him) for him on the path of his Night Journey, and through him, Allah lightened the burden on this community (peace and blessings be upon him). This occurred only through the ruling of the command of this heaven, which Allah revealed within it.

Its day is Thursday. Every secret (سر), knowledge, and Theophany (تجلي) that occurs for the Gnostics (العارفين) originates from the Reality (حقيقة) of Moses in this heaven. Every effect that manifests in the elements (الأركان) and generated entities (المولدات) on Thursday originates from the star of this heaven and the movement of its sphere, generally speaking, without detail. It is associated with the dotted letter *Ḍād* (ض) and the lunar mansion *al-Ṣarfah*. As for the existence of the letters mentioned for each heaven, that heaven has an effect on their existence. However, when we say that a heaven is associated with *al-Ṣarfah* or another mansion, we do not mean that it has an effect on the existence of the mansion, as we meant with the letter. Rather, we mean that when Allah first brought this specific star of this sphere into existence and it began to move, He created it precisely in the mansion we mention for it. That mansion is the station of its good fortune, where its existence manifested. This is the meaning of my saying that it is associated with such-and-such a mansion. Furthermore, every heaven and sphere has an effect on one of the seven minerals, which is specific to it, and it influences that mineral with its power.

***

### Chapter Twenty-Three: Concerning the Name *al-Qāhir* (The Dominant)

The orientation of this Divine Name was toward the creation of the Third Heaven. It manifested its essence (عينها), its star, and its sphere, and made it the dwelling place of Aaron (peace be upon him). By this Divine Name, He revealed His command within it. The existence of its star and the movement of its sphere occurred in the lunar mansion *al-'Awwā'* on Tuesday. Part of the command revealed therein is the shedding of blood and fevers. From the movement of this sphere, the letter *Lām* (ل) appeared among the articulated letters. Every knowledge and secret (سر) of the Divine Secrets that manifests to the Gnostics on Tuesday originates from this heaven, from the spirit of Aaron. Every effect in the elements and generated entities originates from the command of this sphere and the movement of its star. When Allah revealed the command in every heaven, He revealed it through the Divine Name specific to that heaven, and that Name is its source of sustenance (*al-Mumidd*).

***

### Chapter Twenty-Four: Concerning the Name *al-Nūr* (The Light)

The orientation of this Divine Name was toward the creation of the Fourth Heaven, which is the heart of the Cosmos (قلب العالم) and the heart of the heavens. He manifested its essence on Sunday and settled therein the Pole (قطب) of human spirits, Idris (peace be upon him). Allah called this heaven a "high place" (*makānan 'aliyyā*) because it is the heart, even though the heavens above it are physically higher. He intended the elevation of the place's status. Thus, this place has the rank of elevation in status. He created it in the lunar mansion *al-Simāk*, manifested its star and its sphere, and formed the letter *Nūn* (ن) from it. By the movement of its star, He manifested night and day, thereby dividing the day. The Divine Ruling (الحكم الإلهي) in the Cosmos is divided therein. He made one of them female and the other male for the production of what manifests in the elements as generated entities. Everything born and manifested of effects generally throughout all days during the day, its mother is the day and its father is the night. And everything manifested during the night, its mother is the night and its father is the day.
